intro: [WRONG START] Ranunculus auricomus subsp. euryphyphylarius, commonly known as the broad-leaf buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to western North America. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with deeply lobed petals that resemble a crown, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has a basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardens and ecological restoration projects.
